title: SDSS J090745.0+024507
text:
SDSS J090744.99+024506.8 (SDSS 090745.0+024507) is a <a href="Variable%20star">short-period variable</a> star in the constellation <a href="Hydra%20%28constellation%29">Hydra</a>. It has a Galactic rest-frame radial velocity of 709 km/s.
Its <a href="effective%20temperature">effective temperature</a> is 10,500 K (corresponding to a <a href="Stellar%20classification%23Spectral%20types">spectral type</a> of B9) and its age is estimated to be at most 350 million years. It has a heliocentric distance of 71 <a href="Parsec%23Parsecs%20and%20kiloparsecs">kpc</a>. It was ejected from the centre of the galaxy less than 100 million years ago, which implies the existence of a population of young stars at the galactic centre less than 100 million years ago.
Christened by the astronomer <a href="Warren%20Brown%20%28astronomer%29">Warren Brown</a> as the "outcast star", it is the first discovered member of a class of objects named <a href="hypervelocity%20star">hypervelocity star</a>s. It was discovered in 2005 at the <a href="MMT%20Observatory">MMT Observatory</a> of the <a href="Harvard-Smithsonian%20Center%20for%20Astrophysics">Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics</a> (CfA), by astronomers Warren Brown, <a href="Margaret%20J.%20Geller">Margaret J. Geller</a>, <a href="Scott%20J.%20Kenyon">Scott J. Kenyon</a> and <a href="Michael%20J.%20Kurtz">Michael J. Kurtz</a>.
